guide.title: Qt4-based Ebuild HowTo
guide.abstract: This guide is intented to give an overview of how to create a Qt4-based ebuild. It will assist users to write proper ebuilds for Qt4 based packages. using Gentoos' qt4 eclass and splitted Qt4 dependencies

body.p: The first step for your shiny Qt4-based ebuild, is to specify the right EAPI. Current eclass is EAPI 2 compatible, so all you need to do is
That was the most important step for your ebuild.
All qt4 based ebuilds, can use qt4 eclass which provides usefull tools and operation (listed below) for building qt4 applications.

Now all you need to do, is to specify the correct modules on DEPEND variable

pre.caption: Simple example to demonstrate proper qt4 split dependencies usage

body.warn: Even though there is a qt4 metapackage, you must NOT use it as a dependency.

body.p: Qt offers you the ability to build your applications using two different modes:

ul.li: Release: Leads to smaller binaries, usefull for the production state.
Debug: Leads to bigger binaries, usefull for debugging during development process.

body.p: Thus, qt4 eclass can use the 'debug' use flag in order to build your application with debug symbols.
In case 'debug' use flag is present on IUSE, you must adjust the qt dependencies accordingly
body.impo: 'debug' use flag usage implies that you have already followed the "How to get meaningful backtraces in Gentoo" tutorial.

body.p: EAPI2 introduced the src_prepare function which is executed right after src_unpack. The default implementation does nothing. Most of the time, you wont need to use this function at all. Patches are applied automatically via autopatcher
Qt4 eclass uses the base eclass autopatcher in order to apply patches. All you have to do is to specify which patches you want to apply using PATCHES variable

pre.caption: Simple example for using PATCHES variable

body.impo: Please note that PATCHES is an array, so you will always need to includes patches between parenthesis.

body.p: We provide a special function for configuring Qt4 project files. That is eqmake4 which is provided by qt4 eclass. It is based on qmake, plus it uses default Qt variables for proper package configuration. Packages should be configured under src_configure function.
body.impo: eqmake4 does not need a 'die' statement.
body.p: There are some rare occasions where eqmake4 fails, but qmake works. Please fill a bug about this in order to take care of it
